common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connection Issues in Remote Environments
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from remote environments like WSL2 and VS Code DevContainers. This is often due to network inconsistencies and the Pieces OS server listening on the loopback interface. Solutions include enabling dns-tunnel in WSL2, configuring custom URLs, and ensuring the Pieces for VSCode extension is updated to the latest version (2.0.2 or higher).

related_issues.title: VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
related_issues.text:
VSCode extension issue rendering Copilot when installed via snap in WSL2
### Software

VS Code

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

10.1.15

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When Pieces OS is installed via snap in WSL2 for windows and VSCode is also installed through snap in WSL2, there is an issue detecting Pieces OS location and setting the proper API url.


Setting a custom url to the linux port 'http://localhost:5323' and following the WSL steps listed here: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance allows for communication between the VSCode extension and Pieces OS itself.

However, when VSCode attempts to request the Pieces Copilot -- The applet is launched on a port, the port is returned to the extension, but the Copilot fails to render in VSCode.

Until the root cause is detected and resolved, the recommended workaround is to install Pieces OS via Pieces Suite and run VSCode outside of WSL2 if at all possible.
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: Network Issues with VSCode Remote Development in WSL2

**Key points raised:**

* Network inconsistencies observed when using VSCode Remote Development with WSL2, potentially hindering Copilot functionality.

**Problems identified:**

* Difficulties in rendering dynamically hosted content (Copilot) within the Pieces VSCode extension.
* Despite healthchecks returning 'ok', the extension struggles to connect and properly display Copilot.

**Possible solutions proposed/implemented:**

* Investigating known WSL2 network issues and potential solutions:
    * Enabling Systemd option (already implemented)
    * Enabling dns-tunnel 
* Exploring snap installation-related causes

**Current status/outcome:**

* The root cause is yet to be definitively identified. 
* Further investigation is required, specifically regarding dns-tunnel and snap installation aspects. 

**Additional remarks:**

* The issue appears unrelated to WSL2's networking mode (mirrored).
* The discussion highlights the importance of thorough troubleshooting and collaboration between users and developers.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: Connecting to Pieces OS from DevContainer **Key Points Raised:** * User experiencing connection issues between VSCode DevContainer and Pieces OS. * Error message persists even without an open project. * The issue occurs when a remote project is opened in DevContainer. **Problems Identified:** * Default listening interface of Pieces Server changed to loopback for tighter security. * DevContainer mounts access to localhost through 'host.docker.internal' which is not recognized by the server. * Webview tool windows cannot resolve host.docker.internal. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Patch to allow listening on all interfaces is being developed. * Setting to support changing listening interface. * Workaround involving dns name entry creation and modification of /etc/hosts. * Release of VSCode extension version 2.0.1 with automatic detection of Pieces OS. * Updated version 2.0.2 fixes the issue. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue has been resolved in Pieces for VSCode extension version 2.0.2. * User will need to update the extension and try connecting again. **Additional Notes:** * User and developer discussed the issue further over email. * A video call was offered to troubleshoot the issue, but the user has not responded.

related_issues.title: Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
related_issues.text:
Unable to Launch Pieces Windows Desktop Version
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

version: 8.0

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

**Issue:**
I am encountering difficulties with installing and launching the Pieces Windows desktop version. After a successful installation, the software fails to open properly. Despite confirming its presence in the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**Steps to Reproduce:**

- Download and install the Pieces Windows desktop version.
- Attempt to launch the software.
- Observe that the program does not open on the screen.
- Check the task manager to confirm the software is running in the background.

**Expected Behavior:**
Upon installation, the Pieces Windows desktop version should launch and display its interface on the screen, allowing users to interact with it

**Actual Behavior:**
After installation, the software does not open as expected. Despite running in the background according to the task manager, there is no visible output on the screen.

**System Information:**

- Windows version: 22H2 (OS Build 19045)

**Additional Notes:**
I have attempted to troubleshoot this issue without success. Any assistance or insights into resolving this matter would be greatly appreciated. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* Users are experiencing issues launching Pieces OS, with the app failing to launch or showing a blue outline window.
* The issue appears to be affecting both Windows and macOS users.
* The problem seems related to the Pieces Chrome extension, with users receiving a "Failed to connect to Pieces OS" error message.

**Problems Identified:**

* Pieces OS failing to launch.
* Blue outline window appearing instead of the Pieces OS interface.
* "Failed to connect to Pieces OS" error message when using the Pieces Chrome extension.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Checking logs for errors.
* Making sure Microsoft's App Installer technology is up to date.
* Investigating similarities with other reported issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* The issue appears to be ongoing, with users still reporting problems as of January 16, 2025.
* No definitive solution has been identified or implemented yet.

**Additional Notes:**

* Affected users are using Windows 11 and macOS Sequoia 15.2.
* The issue seems to be specific to Pieces OS, as Pieces for Developers is working properly.
* The problem occurs when using both Arc and Chrome browsers.

I hope this summary is helpful. Please let me know if you have any other questions.

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Software Bugs and Errors
common_issues.description: Users report various issues with Pieces OS, including search functionality problems, connectivity issues, and plugin unresponsiveness. Proposed solutions involve software upgrades, log analysis, and bug fixes. The Pieces team actively responds to user reports, investigates issues, and provides updates on resolutions.

related_issues.title: Neural Code Search returns no results
related_issues.text:
Neural Code Search returns no results
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

I have four materials entered since a few days ago and NCS type search never returns anything.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cea82b95-b382-45f3-8777-227d3abd2269)

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/175e6117-9ef6-49c0-94f2-26812b788080)
## Key takeaways from the GitHub issue conversation:

**Issue:** The Pieces search function is confusing and needs improvement.

**Problems identified:**

* Current search options are unclear and not intuitive.
* NCS (semantic) search doesn't find snippets containing specific characters.
* FTS (exact match) search doesn't search metadata.
* User wanted "xyz" search to find snippets with "xyz" in the code.

**Solutions proposed:**

* Major upgrade to search planned for the end of the quarter.
* Current search options explained:
    * NCS: Semantically searches code meaning. Use for finding similar code.
    * FTS: Searches for exact character matches. Use for finding specific code snippets.
    * Blended: Searches content + metadata using fuzzy matching.
* Recommendation to use NCS + Blended search depending on the situation.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The problem is acknowledged and a major search upgrade is planned.
* User is informed about current search options and their functionalities.
* Temporary solution offered until the upgrade is implemented.

**Additional notes:**

* The conversation is between the user (@hovek) and Pieces support team (@pieces-support-bot and @mark-at-pieces).
* The issue was created on January 15, 2025 and further information was provided on January 16, 2025.

related_issues.title: Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
related_issues.text:
Pieces plugin for UltraEdit is unresponsive after asking copilot to describe ~3000 line .py script
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

In UltraEdit I opened the python script available at https://github.com/eldraco/domain_analyzer/blob/master/domain_analyzer.py. I opened the Pieces plugin and using default settings prompted it to describe the script: "What does this Python script do?" The UE plugin never returns any content and seems to be unresponsive. 

In Pieces Desktop, I do see the result, however interaction with it is latent indicating some sort of continual background processing even though the LLM has completed processing. Additionally, there seem to be significant scroll issues, and the code view doesn't appear to be calculating line numbers correctly, showing many empty lines after line 1,918, when line 2,837 is the last line in the file.

Finally, the Pieces Desktop code view shows a wrap in the line number margin.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9be69032-f2e2-4379-843c-cd0bf14da63a)
## GitHub Issue Conversation Summary

**Key points raised:**

* bschwenk reported two issues:
    * Context issue with Gemini 1.5 and gpt4o
    * Line numbers wrapping in code
* mark-at-pieces confirmed the context issue and will investigate further.
* mack-at-pieces confirmed the line number wrapping issue.

**Problems identified:**

* Gemini 1.5 and gpt4o not handling context correctly.
* Line numbers wrapping in code, causing readability issues.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* mark-at-pieces and sam-at-pieces identified a fix for the context issue and implemented it for the next release.
* Line number wrapping issue still being investigated by mack-at-pieces.

**Current status/outcome:**

* Context issue with Gemini 1.5 and gpt4o resolved in the 11.0.4 release.
* Line number wrapping issue still under investigation.

common_issues.title: Pieces Desktop Launch Failures
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces Desktop failing to launch on Windows, often remaining stuck on a connecting screen.  This may be related to background updates or Pieces OS connection issues. Troubleshooting includes checking for updates, submitting logs to support, and ensuring Pieces OS is running.

related_issues.title: Non-dismissable overlay message.
related_issues.text:
Non-dismissable overlay message.
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

v11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

My Pieces app launches at Windows startup (intended). Sometimes, (possibly after a background update?), this dialog appears on my desktop. I don't know what it means, exactly, but I cannot click "Ok" and there is no other way to dismiss it. My only option appears to be to restart the computer, which is often impractical. Please fix!

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f231ef56-3d59-4e94-8cb5-2b54249900cc)
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key Points:**

* User (@ThemePark) reported an issue with Pieces For Desktop not opening.
* Pieces team acknowledged the issue and triaged it to the appropriate member.
* User confirmed having the latest versions of PiecesOS and Desktop.
* Additional information needed for troubleshooting.

**Problems:**

* Pieces For Desktop wouldn't open.

**Solutions:**

* Troubleshooting by Pieces team member, pending additional user information.

**Current Status:**

* Issue acknowledged and under investigation.

**Outcome:**

* To be determined, pending troubleshooting by Pieces team.

common_issues.title: Desktop App UI/UX Bugs
common_issues.description: Users reported various UI/UX bugs in the Pieces Desktop App on macOS, including issues with conversation titles saving prematurely, repetitive welcome messages, and unresponsive Copilot. These issues were acknowledged by the Pieces team and solutions were proposed, such as patches and updates in upcoming releases.

related_issues.title: Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
related_issues.text:
Conversation titles save too eagerly while editing
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

macOS

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.4

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

When I click on the title of Conversation in the Desktop app, I can edit it as expected but it will update save the input before I'm done editing.
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation:

**Key Points:**
- User (@seantiz) reported an issue with experiencing "odd behavior".
- Pieces Support Bot informed about automatic routing to the relevant team member.
- Engineer (@mack-at-pieces) acknowledged the issue and confirmed experiencing the same.

**Problems Identified:**
- User experienced "odd behavior" and reported it in the issue.
- Engineer confirmed experiencing similar behavior.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**
- Engineer acknowledged the issue and stated that they will investigate and release a patch soon.

**Current Status/Outcome:**
- The issue is acknowledged and under investigation by the Pieces team.
- A solution is expected to be provided in the form of a patch.

**Problem:** Gittydia reported an issue with Copilot, receiving the error message "I'm sorry. Something went wrong with processing...".

**Key Points:**

* Issue automatically routed to the Pieces team.

* User provided with helpful resources.
* Fix expected in the next PiecesOS release 11.0.4 on Thursday.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Fix expected in PiecesOS release 11.0.4 on Thursday.
* User asked to report back if the issue persists after the update.

**Overall, the issue seems to be acknowledged and a fix is expected soon.**

common_issues.title: Pieces OS Launch and Performance Issues
common_issues.description: Users report Pieces OS failing to launch, high RAM usage, CPU spikes, and connection issues.  Suggested workarounds include restarting the app, optimizing memory, disabling 'Live Context', and checking for updates.  Pieces team is aware of these issues and actively investigating solutions.

related_issues.title: PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
related_issues.text:
PiecesOS using too much RAM/spike in CPU
Several users have called in recently about Pieces using too much RAM or causing a spike in CPU up to 100%. We are trying to track down this issue, and would appreciate any feedback about your experience with this if you are experiencing it. 

We have a hunch it has something to do with internet connections, but aren't fully sure yet. 

If you're experiencing this and wouldn't mind hopping on a call with us to show us, we would really appreciate it to help us troubleshoot! You can schedule a call [here](https://calendar.google.com/calendar/u/0/appointments/schedules/AcZssZ2iaRWpd1kA2k_xg2KrVi_jiTHo0POiMZSI9WAYsxs5jJ9sU2Rd2zKitLuSFd7l3FhatGzy5Vgt
). 

A short-term solution is to restart PiecesOS whenever this occurs. 
## Pieces OS High RAM Usage Summary

**Key Points:**

* Pieces OS is a local server that powers the Pieces product suite, requiring significant resources.
* Many users are reporting high RAM usage, sometimes exceeding 5GB, even with no models running.
* This issue seems to be exacerbated by the "Live Context" feature.

**Problems Identified:**

* High RAM usage, making Pieces unusable for some users.
* Occasional CPU spikes, slowing down other applications.
* Concerns about potential data mining due to high resource usage.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* "Optimize Memory" feature to unload unused ML models.
* Continuous efforts to improve performance and reduce resource consumption.
* Offering calls to diagnose individual issues.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Pieces acknowledges the issue and is working on improvements.
* Current workaround is to use the "Optimize Memory" feature and disable "Live Context" if necessary.
* Many users are still experiencing high resource usage, impacting their workflow.

**Additional Notes:**

* This issue has been ongoing since April 2024 and remains unresolved as of January 2025.
* Some users have uninstalled Pieces due to the resource usage.
* This issue is particularly problematic for users with limited RAM or CPU resources.
